members.member:
A request that asks the SM to blend together all of the HF manifests and compute a single effective manifest file that gets returned to the client. The data should be [bool] AsyncRequest - if true, the request will return a success result immediately and you'll get a eThinSessionEvt_RecvComponentList event when the data is ready. If false, you'll get the standard HRESULT error code.
If successful HRESULT is seen, the response data is: [string] Manifest - the effective manifest file.
For internal use only.

Get a file in the user area on the server. The method is async, it will return immediately and you'll get subsequent events with the blocks of the file data. The parameters are:
[string] File name. This is the trailing part of the file name, for example a value of "MySettings.xml" is fine, which will be put into your user area on the server [DWORD RecommendBlockSize [DWORD] dwTransferToken - the correlation id you want to assoc with this req For internal use only.

Put a file in the user area on the server. You can invoke this method multiple time to put the file in small chunks. I recommed putting chunks of 2048 bytes, which is what the standard FTP does. I assume it's a good size :) The parameters are:
[string] File name. This is the trailing part of the file name, for example a value of "MySettings.xml" is fine, which will be put into your user area on the server [enum FileTransferPacketType] this is a bitwise DWORD, turn on the bit for "first block" and "last block" as appropriate. Using these bits, it's easy to send the file in whatever chunk size you like [DWORD] Size of data block. [BYTE*] the actual data BYTEs. For internal use only.

Turn on or off the watch for MWI events
[bool] On For internal use only.

Request to get the list of voice mails from the user's inbox. the response does not contain the data, this request is async. When the data is ready you'll get an eThinSessionEvt_VoiceMessageList For internal use only.

Request to play a given voice message to the station handset. A request will first stop any existing message that's playing.
[string] Message Id For internal use only.

Request to stop playing any voice mail message that is currently playing
[string] Message Id For internal use only.

Fired in response to a eThinManagerReq_DownloadComponentList request when in async mode and the list is computed. The payload data is a standard HRESULT followed by a string description for failure codes and a zero or one xml manifest files for success codes. For internal use only.
Fired in when a user file is updated with the PutUserFile api For internal use only.

member.name: T:ININ.IceLib.Connection.ConnectionState
member.summary: Specifies constants indicating the state of a Session's connection.

remarks.para: This enumeration is used in conjunction with by Session to specify the state of its connection.
The ConnectionState state machine looks like the following:

The following are connection states (followed by their transition symbols):
Up(U)
Down(D)
Attempting(A)
None(N)
The following are connection state reasons (followed by their applicable transitions):
Switchover(U->D)
SessionTimeout(U->D)
UserLogOff(U->D)
LogOn(N->A, A->U)
LogOnFailed(A->D)
AnotherLogOn(U->D)
StationDeactivated(U->D)
StationDeleted(U->D)
AdminLogoff(U->D)
ServerNotResponding(U->L, A->D, L->A, A->L)
None(Initial state)

member.returns: The profile items.

This method will return the value from the cache, if the attribute is cached. If the attribute is not being cached, it will send a request to the server and get the attribute.
Requesting a namespace will cause that namespace, and all sub-namespaces, to be returned and cached. This can be used to pre-cache all profile items for a root namespace and make subsequent requests for profile items return from the local cache instead of issuing a server request.

member.name: T:ININ.IceLib.Connection.Extensions.ProxyAuthSettings
member.summary: Passed to a Session in order to authenticate an Interaction Center user that is creating a session on behalf of another Interaction Center user.

remarks.para: The object is used to specify Interaction Center proxy user authentication settings. This is used when an IC user name and password should be used to authenticate the proxy user requesting a Session on behalf of another Interaction Center user. In order to do proxy logins the proxy user must have the I3_VALUE_RIGHT_MISC_PROXY_LOGINS right set in Interaction Administrator.
The object can be used with the object to supply the and arguments to the Connect method of the object.
remarks.note: In 2.4 SU 27 and beyond the server parameter UsersWithProxyLoginRight is used to set the list of users that have rights to perform proxy logins via this class. The value for this parameter should contain a '|' delimited list of user IDs. However, in 3.0 and beyond the logged in user must have a specific "Proxy Logins" Access Control right configured on their IC User via the Interaction Administrator application. This setting is in the "Miscellaneous" section of the Access Control settings.

The value for this parameter should contain a '|' delimited list of user IDs. However, in 3.0 and beyond the logged in user must have a specific "Proxy Logins" Access Control right configured on their IC User via the Interaction Administrator application. This setting is in the "Miscellaneous" section of the Access Control settings.

member.name: T:ININ.IceLib.Connection.HostEndpoint
member.summary: Represents an endpoint for BridgeHost connections.

remarks.para: This is used by the class to specify an endpoint (i.e. BridgeHost) for the Session to use when attempting a connection.
remarks.note: BridgeHost is the connector between thin clients and the Session Manager. It translates network protocols, socket-level security checking, and other tasks during a thin client-to-Session Manager exchange.

member.name: F:ININ.IceLib.Connection.HostEndpoint.DefaultPort
member.summary: Represents the default Port. This field is read-only.
member.remarks: If the property is set to this value, then the default BridgeHost port will be used.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified host.
member.remarks: The host will attempt to be parsed for the [host]:[port] format. The port will default to if not set.

member.name: M:ININ.IceLib.Connection.HostEndpoint.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified host and port.
member.remarks: The host will attempt to be parsed for the [host]:[port] format. If the port is not found in this format, it will be set by the port parameter.
member.exception: The parameter is less than 1 or greater than 65535.

member.name: M:ININ.IceLib.Connection.HostEndpoint.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified host and port and adds a reference to itself as the only resolved endpoint.
member.param: if set to , resolve to self.

remarks.para: This constructor may be used to initialize an instance of that is known to resolve only to itself. Since uses network-bound DNS operations, it is advantageous to create self-resolving endpoints when possible to reduce unnecessary network overhead.
This also serves to limit the number of unique instances of .

member.exception: The parameter is less than 1 or greater than 65535.

member.name: F:ININ.IceLib.Connection.HostEndpoint.DefaultHost
member.summary: Represents the default Host. This field is read-only.

remarks.para: If the property is set to this value, then the default BridgeHost host will be used.

Retrieves the default host server stored in the registry. It will first look in HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Interactive Intelligence\EIC\BridgeHost in the default key. Then if that is blank it will look in the same place under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE. Finally, if that is also blank, it defaults to i3ClientSrv. It is recommended that sites create a DNS alias to their BridgeHost server with that name.

member.name: T:ININ.IceLib.Connection.Internal.FallbackLocation
member.summary: For internal use only. A fallback location to be used when the primary location is unreachable.
member.remarks: When attempting to connect, IceLib should first attempt to connect to any session manager instance associated with the location mapped to the user. If the user is not mapped, then the location mapped to the station. If the user / station location is unreachable, that location will contain a list of fallback location. Each fallback location has a priority order index indicated the order in which fallback locations should be attempted. Multiple fallback locations may share a priority order index value, and in this case these locations are considered peers: IceLib should attempt all un-attempted session manager instances associated with those locations before attempting the next lower priority fallback location.

Helper function to calculate the M2 value in the SRP6 protocol.
For complete information, read the comments in the SetParameters() functions the bytes of the M2 value

Helper function to calculate the M1 value in the SRP6 protocol.
For complete information, read the comments in the SetParameters() functions the bytes of the M1 value

Helper function to munge the clear text password into an obfuscated hash.
This isn't necessary for SRP6 protocol, but it is needed because of how CIC stores user passwords. Basically you cannot modify these MungeXXX functions unless the CIC system changes to match, this code is meant to directly mirror what CIC does.

summary.para: The ININ.IceLib.Connection namespace contains classes for connecting with Interaction Center.

There are a number of classes within the ININ.IceLib.Connection namespace that provide support to the classes mentioned in the preceding summary. Example of the supporting classes are enumerations, event argument classes, and delegates used by events within classes.
Session. The object is the root of any IceLib connection with the IC server. It accepts various settings to describe the session and provides events when the connection state changes.
Host Settings. The is used to specify the BridgeHost to which a Session should be established.

Authentication Settings. There are a number of object classes that are used to specify authentication settings for the Session such as what IC User ID and Password to login with. All such objects inherit from . Examples of authentication classes are:
and ,

Station Settings. There are a number of object classes that are used to specify station settings for the Session such as what remote number is serving as the User's station. All such objects inherit from . Examples of station classes are:
and ,
summary.note: All "manager" classes found in the IceLib library are designed as singletons-classes instantiated only once. For example, to begin working with any of the functionality provided in the ININ.IceLib.Interactions.InteractionsManager, you must obtain the instance through a call to its GetInstance method.

member.name: T:ININ.IceLib.Connection.Session
member.summary: Represents the connection Session with the Interaction Center server.

remarks.para: The is the root of any IceLib connection with the IC server. It accepts various settings to describe the session and provides events when there is a change in connection settings or connection state.
Host Settings. The is used to specify the BridgeHost to which a Session should be established.

Authentication Settings. There are a number of object classes that are used to specify authentication settings for the Session such as what IC User ID and Password to login with. All such objects inherit from . Examples of authentication classes are:
and ,

Station Settings. There are a number of object classes that are used to specify station settings for the Session such as what remote number is serving as the User's station. All such objects inherit from . Examples of station classes are:
and ,

example.note: All "manager" classes found in the IceLib library are designed as singletons-classes instantiated only once. For example, to begin working with any of the functionality provided in the ININ.IceLib.Interactions.InteractionsManager, you must obtain the instance through a call to its GetInstance method.

member.name: M:ININ.IceLib.Connection.Session.Connect(ININ.IceLib.Connection.SessionSettings,ININ.IceLib.Connection.HostSettings,ININ.IceLib.Connection.AuthSettings,ININ.IceLib.Connection.StationSettings)
member.summary: Connects the session using the specified settings.

remarks.para: For security reasons a user can only be logged in to one station at a time. If the user logs in to a different station, the system drops the original station connection. Multiple instances of client applications may be run on the same machine using different user logins and the same station.

If a user who is logged in via Interaction Client .NET Edition tries, for example, to connect using Interaction Client Web Edition, they will receive a message at the original station such as: "Your connection has been dropped due to a subsequent login on a different station".

member.exception: A required license is not available.

member.name: P:ININ.IceLib.Connection.Session.AttemptToSetThreadCulture
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to attempt to set IceLib's background threads' .
member.value: if should attempt to set thread culture; otherwise, .

remarks.para: This is an optional convenience that simplifies the work of any custom applications that require their threads' to be set. IceLib does not rely on for whether it should load its string resources, but does use .
If set to , IceLib will attempt to set the of its background threads to the value in (as specified by SessionSettings.IsoLanguage). The background threads' will never be set by IceLib.
This setting defaults to .
The clock skew accounts for slight differences in the clock adjustment of the local client versus the IC server. It does not account for timezone differences.
This value is exposed to allow conversion of times between client and server for custom attributes or other values outside of the control of IceLib itself.

The relationship of clock skew to client and server times can be described as follows:
[Clock Skew] = [Server Time Now in Local Time] - [Client Time Now]
[IceLib Client Time] = [Server Time in Local Time] - [Clock Skew] - [AdditionalUtcOffset]
[Server Time in Local Time] = [IceLib Client Time] + [Clock Skew] + [AdditionalUtcOffset]
As shown, IceLib DateTime values are also affected by the , if one is specified.

member.name: P:ININ.IceLib.Connection.Session.AdditionalUtcOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets an additional clock skew for the session.

remarks.para: The default is a time span of 0. This can be changed to perform a "proxy" time adjustment as if the user were logging in from another machine. For instance, a web server might want to artificially adjust time to match where the web browser is running.

This time span will be added into all IceLib values:
[Clock Skew] = [Server Time Now in Local Time] - [Client Time Now]
[IceLib Client Time] = [Server Time in Local Time] - [Clock Skew] - [AdditionalUtcOffset]
[Server Time in Local Time] = [IceLib Client Time] + [Clock Skew] + [AdditionalUtcOffset]

member.name: T:ININ.IceLib.Connection.StationConnectionMode
member.summary: Used to change the station login and logout behavior with respect to the IceLib Session.
member.remarks: The StationConnectionMode can be used to indicate how the system should manage the user's station session. If StationConnectionMode.Default is specified, the user will be logged into the specified station when the IceLib Session connects, and will be logged out of that station when the IceLib Session is disconnected. If is specified, the user will be logged into the station while the IceLib Session connects and also after Session disconnects. When is used, all station connections for the user that have the same application group ID as the current session will be disconnected when the IceLib Session is disconnected.

member.name: F:ININ.IceLib.Connection.StationConnectionMode.Default
member.summary: The user should be logged out of the station when the IceLib Session is disconnected.

member.name: F:ININ.IceLib.Connection.StationConnectionMode.IndependentOfSession
member.summary: The user should remain logged into the station when the IceLib Session is disconnected.
member.remarks: Setting this mode and disconnecting the IceLib will mean that the user is still logged into the station. To log these session out at a later time, set the mode to and disconnect the session.
member.note: This mode should not be used in combination with a Remote Number workstation (see ) at this time as Interaction Center does not support this mode.

member.name: F:ININ.IceLib.Connection.StationConnectionMode.IndependentConnectionsLogoutWithSession
member.summary: Indicates that this station login, as well as those created for with using the same application group ID should be logged out when this IceLib Session is disconnected.
member.remarks: This mode is used to disconnect a user from a station that they are connected to using . Disconnecting an IceLib that has this mode set will log that specific user out of the station associated with that Session. In addition, the user's status will be shown as 'logged out' even if any .net clients are logged in.

remarks.para: The object contains information about the connected Station associated with a Session. You can get or set the station's extension, ID, SIP address, user, and station type, and other properties.

member.overloads: Performs a task.
member.summary: Performs a task, with no callbacks.

remarks.para: This registers the task (by asyncTaskState.TaskId), initiates performance of the task on a separate thread, then returns.
The performTaskCallback will be executed on an arbitrary thread. If this throws an exception, it will be caught and placed into the asyncTaskState automatically.
Once the operation completes, the completedCallback will be executed automatically on the UI thread (unless the task has been cancelled via a call to ).

The performTaskCallback will be executed on an arbitrary thread. If this throws an exception, it will be caught and placed into the asyncTaskState automatically.
Once the operation completes, the completedCallback will be executed automatically on the UI thread (unless the task has been cancelled via a call to ).

It can be used to raise a non-generic event that needs a specific subclass as its second parameter. This method assumes that points to a method that conforms to the standard .NET event signature. That is, it takes an as its first parameter and an instance as its second.
remarks.note: If the EventArgs is of an incorrect type for this event, or the event does not conform to the standard object/EventArgs pattern, then the event sinks will not be called!

member.name: T:ININ.IceLib.Internal.ManagedWeakReferenceCache`2
member.summary: A cached collection of keyed weak references to objects of type that attempts to keep a handle on how many dangling keyvalue pairs are left in the collection. Where a dangling keyvalue pair is defined as a pair where the weak reference (the value) has been garbage collected. The collection cleans up dangling references when a operation fails to find a valid value, by removing the first encountered dangling keyvalue pair before adding in the new pair. To consider a value valid requires both the key to be present and for the weak reference to have not been garbage collected.
member.typeparam: The type of the cached item key.
The type of the cached item.
member.remarks: Be aware of the usage of this cache and the mechanism used to keep a handle on the dangling keyvalue pairs. If for example a large amount of items were injected into the cache, but very seldomly accessed then this class should be enhanced to handle that situation by cleaning more than one (possibly all dangling pairs) and/or cleaning via a timed interval.

member.name: M:ININ.IceLib.Internal.NativeMethods.WTSQuerySessionInformation(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,ININ.IceLib.Internal.NativeMethods.WTS_INFO_CLASS,System.IntPtr@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: The WTSQuerySessionInformation function retrieves session information for the specified session on the specified terminal server. It can be used to query session information on local and remote terminal servers. http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/termserv/termserv/wtsquerysessioninformation.asp
member.param: Handle to a terminal server. Specify a handle opened by the WTSOpenServer function, or specify to indicate the terminal server on which your application is running.

A Terminal Services session identifier. To indicate the session in which the calling application is running (or the current session) specify . Only specify when obtaining session information on the local server. If it is specified when querying session information on a remote server, the returned session information will be inconsistent. Do not use the returned data in this situation.
Specifies the type of information to retrieve. This parameter can be one of the values from the enumeration type.

Pointer to a variable that receives a pointer to the requested information. The format and contents of the data depend on the information class specified in the parameter. To free the returned buffer, call the function.
Pointer to a variable that receives the size, in bytes, of the data returned in ppBuffer.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a nonzero value. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: F:ININ.IceLib.Internal.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_REMOTESESSION
member.summary: Windows XP (v5.1+) This system metric is used in a Terminal Services environment. If the calling process is associated with a Terminal Services client session, the return value is nonzero. If the calling process is associated with the Terminal Server console session, the return value is zero. The console session is not necessarily the physical console - see WTSGetActiveConsoleSessionId for more information.

member.remarks: This method gets a write lock on the that protects , checks that still does not contain an entry for the passed in, and then creates an entry using that key. member.summary: Gets or sets the file path of the local file.
member.remarks: For a download request, this is the base filename where the file will be downloaded to. For an upload request, this is the full path to the local file that will be uploaded.

member.name: P:ININ.IceLib.FileTransferSettings.TransferComplete
member.summary: Gets or sets the transfer complete.

member.name: P:ININ.IceLib.FileTransferSettings.Key
member.remarks: For a download request, this value is used to lock other file transfer requests, to avoid contention for multiple threads trying to download the same file. For an upload request, this is used as the base filename that the uploaded file should be named on the server. If this is not set for an upload request, then the base name will be retrieved from the the .

member.name: P:ININ.IceLib.FileTransferSettings.FileType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the file.

member.name: P:ININ.IceLib.FileTransferSettings.AllowStaleData
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to allow stale data.
member.remarks: If stale data is allowed, then in cases where the file could not be downloaded, the cached file contents will be returned, even if it is not up to date.
member.value: if stale data is allowed; otherwise, .

member.name: P:ININ.IceLib.FileTransferSettings.CacheFileType
member.summary: Gets or sets the cache file type to be handled.
member.remarks: For file downloads, this value is used to determine the location of the file in IceLib's file cache. For file uploads, setting this value to other than , will cause the uploaded file to be copied to the local IceLib cache, and the file's eTag updated to the appropriate value (as received from the HttpPluginHost).
member.value: The cache file type to handle after a successful upload.

member.name: P:ININ.IceLib.FileTransferSettings.ETag
member.summary: Gets or sets the eTag for a download request.
member.remarks: After calling or , this value will be the value. This value is expressed as UTC.

summary.para: The ININ.IceLib namespace contains fundamental classes and base classes for creating Interaction Center based applications. These include commonly-used value and reference data types, events and event handlers, interfaces, attributes, and processing exceptions.

Exceptions. There are a number of exceptions that can be thrown throughout IceLib. These are intended to allow custom applications to receive information about specific error conditions and be able to handle the condition accordingly. All such exceptions inherit from . Examples of Interaction classes are: , , and .

Tracing. The object offers support for simple tracing. These trace statements will be written into the Interactive Intelligence trace log for the running application instance. All such trace statements will be written to the "IceLib_Custom" trace topic.

member.name: T:ININ.IceLib.NotCachedException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown for IceLib when a required value is not cached.

remarks.para: This exception is thrown by various IceLib objects when a requested watched value has not yet been cached. This is usually due to not having a watch for that value, but can also happen if an asynchronous watch is requested and the value is queried before the asynchronous watch operation completes.
Like all IceLib-specific exceptions, this object derives from , allowing consistent exception handling for all such exceptions.
